content.description: Start almost sitting on the jug rail under the arete, make the big move before moving up and right to gain a sidepull that lets you stand up to the lip.
content.location: On the larger boulder that follows the broken rock bands that start Fractured Rock. See topo.

content.description: Sit start as for Learning to Stand (V2), make the big move, then set up for a throw to the lip. There's an edge up there that's latch-able(?). I never got it anyway, could be harder but I suspect it's no easier than V6. It felt not possible when I was climbing the occasional V6 in Pawtuckaway.
content.protection: Single pad, spotter isn't a bad idea due to the dynamic nature...
content.location: Shares a start with Learning to Stand on Fractured Rock. See topo.

content.description: Sit start in a lower crack and move straight up to the higher crack, which you'll follow to topout. Nice fine-textured schist and good, friendly holds.
content.location: On Fractured Rock, up and right of the other two routes. See topo as well.

content.description: A band of okay rock holding two V0s leads up to a ~15' boulder of fine-grained schist that holds a fun (and long for the area) V2, and potential for a V6 or harder one-move-wonder project.
